content:
When https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/91062 lands, it will be possible to symlink all the JS and CSS from some generated rustdoc to the original JS and CSS in your rust checkout, so you can iterate on those files and see the results just by reloading.

I have a little shell script locally that does the symlinking. Where would be the best place to put it in-repo? src/tools/rustdoc-symlinker? Also, is shell acceptable or do I need to rewrite it in Rust? :-)
src/tools sounds great, and as a utility i think shell is fine
If it's going to be in shell I think src/etc is a better place
(so you can just put it at the top level without needing a directory)
